intro: Ouratea pobeguinii, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes a diverse group of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange inflorescences that resemble mist or clouds, hence its common name. Its leaves are typically opposite and elliptical, with a glossy surface. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
